intro: Scaligeria takharensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian scaligeria, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, and it produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scaligeria takharensis is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
